amendment.description: Amendment requires a public safety report to be provided to the House and Senate Transportation Committees on the security of locations intended to encourage public use of alternative transportation as well as personal transportation such as car pool parking lots, mass transit parking; local, state, and regional rail station parking; college or university parking; bike paths or walking trails and other locations the Secretary deems would be appropriate.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 20 printed in Part B of House Report 114-325 to seek a public safety report to be provided to the House and Senate Transportation Committees on the security of locations intended to encourage public use of alternative transportation as well as personal transportation such as car pool parking lots, mass transit parking; local, state, and regional rail station parking; college or university parking, bike paths or walking trails and other locations the Secretary deems would be appropriate.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Sewell (AL) amendment (A020) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A020) offered by Ms. Sewell (AL) to the Rules amendment (A001).
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Sewell (AL) amendment (A020) Agreed to by voice vote.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A020) offered by Ms. Sewell (AL) to the Rules amendment (A001).
